summary: An FBI Miami letter to the Bureau of Prisons Office of General Counsel requesting information on two inmates as part of an ongoing investigation. The request seeks custody details for an unnamed white male inmate and for Berry Lester Kessler, who is believed to be deceased.

persons.name: John V. Gillies
persons.role: Special Agent in Charge, FBI Miami
persons.context: The Special Agent in Charge who signed the official FBI request letter to the Bureau of Prisons.

persons.name: Berry Lester Kessler
persons.context: One of two inmates for whom the FBI is requesting custody information; the document states he is believed to be deceased.

events.title: FBI Information Request to BOP
events.description: FBI Miami sends a formal letter to the Bureau of Prisons Office of General Counsel requesting detailed custody information on two inmates as part of an ongoing investigation.

keyFacts: The FBI Miami field office was conducting an ongoing investigation in October 2010 that required information from the Bureau of Prisons.
The request sought information on two inmates: an unnamed white male and Berry Lester Kessler.
Berry Lester Kessler was believed by the FBI to be deceased at the time of the request.
The document is an official, signed communication from FBI Special Agent in Charge John V. Gillies.
The request seeks specific custody details including dates in custody, facility assignments, and release or death dates.
